ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a lot about poets, learned how to have fun reading for class, and thought a lot about what it means to know someone and how to write about and think about people. What is truth? What is bias? What is a life?
We got to learn the techniques of the biographer, and get acquainted with a lot of amazing poetry.

I learned three categories of things things in this course: 1) information about the subjects of the biographies we read, 2) the theory of biography and the decision a biographer makes in writing one, 3) best practices and good habits of performing archival research.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: Incredible book choice: Roffman picks these books because she loves them. They're all great reads, and even if you don't love them, she's so excited about them that it makes them exciting. Great discussions: Roffman knows how to lead a discussion, and even when you don't know what you're trying to say, she'll figure out what you're trying to say and say it better and make it profound. Awesome, individualized assignments: The big research project for this class is endlessly flexible, so you can really make it your own. 
Weaknesses: None.
The only thing I would improve on was that I wouldve liked to have read fewer biographies of writers and more of other kinds of historical figures.
This course only had strengths. It was an incredible course and I am so glad that I had the opportunity to take it.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. Without hesitation, I would take any class that Karin Roffman teaches. This class in particular is no exception. It demands a lot of reading and a lot of research effort, but all of the books were fascinating reads and led to great discussions, and the research project can be personalized into really any form. If you love poetry and/or biography, this is an especially great class for you.
Yes, if you're interested in writing at all this course will make you a better writer.

Absolutely. This class was transformative and essential, but it was also really fun to take. I enjoyed every single one of the books we read, and we were given a lot of creative latitude in the assignments.

Yes 100%- one of the best classes I have taken at Yale. I had never thought about the biographical genre before this class and now I think about it all the time. All of the book were great and read in sequence you really get a sense of possibility for all the ways in which you can talk about another person's life. Most of them are unconventional biographies, so not boring at all. Professor Roffman is great and facilitates a really wonderful intellectual environment / conversation in class.
